attributes.action: Remove  the Commercial speed restrictions on vehicles such as duel use pickups,
attributes.background: Vehicles such as Dual Cab pickups are still subjected to commercial speed restrictions on certain roads due to their curb weight even thou they are someone’s personal vehicle and not used for commercial use, remove these restrictions for personal use vehicles,
attributes.additional_details: If your pickup exceeds a unladen weight of 2048 kilos it has speed restrictions on certain roads which is rubbish as most modern cars such as range rovers weight sometimes over 3 tonne, just because a vehicle is deemed commercial doesn’t mean it should be restricted, personal use commercial vehicles not being used for business shouldn’t be subjected to this law, as new pick ups have better safety equipment than when this law was written,

attributes.action: Demonstrate how more disabled people in the workforce has impacted productivity.
attributes.background: On the 6/12/17, whilst giving evidence to the commons Treasury Select committee, Phillip Hammond stated that "It is almost certainly the case that...very high levels of engagement in the workforce, for example of disabled people...may have had an impact on overall productivity measurements.
attributes.additional_details:
For a full transcript, follow the link

http://data.parliament.uk/writtenevidence/committeeevidence.svc/evidencedocument/treasury-committee/budget-autumn-2017/oral/75188.html

attributes.action: Ban Smoking on streets
attributes.background: Smoking on the streets is bad for other people through passive smoking and the environment.
attributes.additional_details: It was proven that when the indoor smoking ban was brought into force over 700,000 people stopped smoking

attributes.action: Amnesty for illegal immigrants who have been in UK for 7 years
attributes.background: People who lived here more than 7 years have a huge social circle. Everyone is connected to each other. Deporting these immigrants will leave a very bad impact on their familes and local community. If they are legally allowed, govt will get huge revenue in terms of income tax and national insurance.

attributes.action: Remove the household means assessment from student loans for all adult students.
attributes.background:
Parental maintenance cease at 18. The UK government assesses an entitlement to a student loan for an adult upon the income of people who live in their household but may have had no previous financial responsibility for ? 
Allow all students to apply for the maximum award. It’s all repayable
attributes.additional_details: The student loan assessment is unfair. A common example is where a students mother lives with a new partner. The partner earns a good salary and pays maintenance for his existing children - however the student applying for university must ask this man, who s/he may only have known for a year for their financial details. Then will be awarded a lesser sum because of this man income . With the expectation that he will top up the reduced loan. This rarely happens leaving the student disadvantaged.

attributes.action: Provide armed security for the Orthodox Jewish Community in the UK
attributes.background: European governments are providing armed security for synagogues and Jewish institutions following numerous fatal terror attacks. This is because where there is a serious risk of fatalities, the only feasible solution is to provide armed security for Jewish public places. The UK must do the same.
attributes.additional_details:
The Terror threat level in Europe is getting worse, with innocent people of all races being murdered. The threat to the Jewish community is always greater, in particular when elements of the media promote anti-semitic perspectives on the Middle East conflict. The Gov't Provides armed Police for Foreign embassies and must do the same for it's own citizens who need it.

It is impossible for a policeman or security guard without a weapon to protect sites from  terrorists armed with weapons.

attributes.action: Replace the financial ombudsman service with a publicly funded organisation
attributes.background: I believe that the ombudsman service just has not got the ability to handle complaints about financial services. There is evidence in the media and on online review services like trustpilot.
attributes.additional_details: I would like the government to consider replacing the financial ombudsman service with a publicly funded organisation that is not funded by, or affiliated with, the banks and other financial services.

attributes.action: Introduce a (5%) Voluntary Tax where people can allocate as they choose
attributes.background: There is a lot of shouting about the lack of funds here and there. NHS, education, police and soforth. But no-one especially wants a tax raise, especially when their funds are tight. What this idea is a voluntary tax, but one where a person can specifically choose where that tax goes.
attributes.additional_details:
The way it would work it would be something that people can opt-in, or opt-out. Opt-in of a voluntary tax, and they would then pick a choice where they want that payment of tax to be allocated. For example.
>NHS >Education >Roads >Railways >Military etc.

attributes.action: To implement a notice period before stopping disability benefits after reviewing
attributes.background: At present many genuine disability claimants are losing benefits without any prior warning after going through a biased assessment process. Thus placing them instantly into financial difficulties and a world of uncertainty & worry even rendering many unable to actually pay the bills etc.
attributes.additional_details: Being thrust into a world of woe. Going through the stresses of being suddenly financially restricted then chasing the gov for reconsideration and then forcing an appeal process which many win this process surely costs the gov even more going through the whole tribunal process takes months to  year. Yes the money gets backdated. But all that addition stress and worry is totally Unnecessary. In human rights terms it's totally disgusting that our DWP treats the disabled this way.

attributes.action: Allow the purchase of alcohol between 8am and 11pm
attributes.background: The purchase of alcohol should be allowed between 8am and 11pm as the times the law describe are just too late. I have personal relations with close friends who are heavily reliant on alcohol and need it for medicinal reasons but have to endure a long mornings and nights in pain.
attributes.additional_details: It is understood the reasons for the times that are set but i honestly feel the reasons behind this law have now become mostly irrelevant. It is unfair on these people who have to suffer most mornings and nights because of this. It is hard seeing close ones in these situations.

attributes.action: Allow Left turns on red like in the USA
attributes.background: So in the USA you can legally turn Right on a red light which helps with easing traffic and lowering co2 emmisons So I think that when applicable We should be allowed to turn left on red due to us driving on the left side of the road. This would greatly decrease co2 emmisons and traffic in cities.

attributes.action: Make a legal requirement to have a valid horse owners certificate to own a horse
attributes.background: Currently any individual can own a horse or pony regardless of their knowledge of basic horse care. This has led to a rise in equine welfare cases, with many horses/ponies being neglected, abused and killed due to the owners lack of fundamental equine care knowledge.
attributes.additional_details: The horse owners certificate is already an optional qualification provided by the British horse society. It teaches a person essential knowledge on equine maintenance, nutrition, care and first aid. Making this qualification a legal requirement for all horse owners will have a dramatic positive effect in the equestrian community and will aim to massively reduce the number of welfare cases involving horses inappropriately cared for.

attributes.action: Stop stretched NHS staff being criminalised and struck off for honest mistakes.
attributes.background: We ask government to adopt a ‘just’ approach in healthcare investigation to ensure staff aren’t scapegoated for systemic errors. 1) Change the Law so staff errors are only prosecuted if intentional or grossly careless 2) Change the Medical Act so regulators are limited to retraining, not punishment.
attributes.additional_details:
NHS working conditions are incredibly stretched. Despite understaffing and underfunding, staff face criminal charges and losing their licence to work forever if they make an honest mistake. This is unfair, unconstructive and worsens patient safety. 

We ask government to adopt a ‘just’/‘no blame’ approach to healthcare investigation (like the aviation industry) to save taxpayers money, improve NHS working conditions and staff retainment, and streamline error investigation to make patients safer.

attributes.action: Rename HMS Prince Of Wales to HMS Ark Royal
attributes.background: We have had an HMS Ark Royal in the royal navy since 1587 the flagship of the English fleet during the spanish armada campaign its always been the flag ship of the royal navy so it is only right to rename Hms Prince of Wales to Hms Ark royal
attributes.additional_details: The british people want a new Hms Ark royal

attributes.action: Compulsory training for food establishments with an FSA score of less than 3
attributes.background: We want the law changed in that all food establishments who score below a 3 on a hygiene inspection by the FSA, are required to take on an outside agency to retrain staff and owners. Should their scores not improve following training, then they should be closed down.
attributes.additional_details:
Having become aware of establishments that are allowed to stay open despite having a low FSA score and potentially putting the general public at risk due to their lack of management skills, hygiene & food safety, there now is a serious need for the system to be looked at.
At present anyone can open a food outlet, whether it be a restaurant, cafe, takeaway, outside catering or a bakery, with only the requirement of a certificate; which can easily be obtained online. Whilst this promotes & aids businesses, it also opens the floodgates to public safety. The training would be at the cost of the business. It would create jobs as well as assisting the businesses in gaining the scores that they should have & maintain high standards in the food industry & public safety.

attributes.action: Lower the cost of taking the Practical driving test.
attributes.background: Every year roughly 850,000 driving tests are conducted but only 47-50% pass. That means one in two tests taken leads to a fail. Although the tests are getting harder, the price of it still remains incredibly high at £62.00. Driving should be a fun and educational life skill not a burden.
attributes.additional_details:
1. Roughly 850,000 driving tests are taken every year in the UK.
2. Only 47-50% pass the test.
3. Tests are getting harder but price is still sky high at £62.00.
4. If you are using your instructors vehicle the cost may increase even more.

attributes.action: Give disabled victims of crime funding for support & services to obtain justice!
attributes.background: Disabled people such as those suffering with Autism find dealing with stress and anxiety very difficult, especially when they are victims of crime, it has a huge negative impact on their health, their life both at work and at home as well as their mental well being.
attributes.additional_details: Adequate funding and support should always be available via a bespoke fund for those disabled victims such as autistics or those with mental disabilities ensuring their needs are met to provide the services and support required so the most vulnerable in our society, who struggle to cope with life in general, let alone when they are the victims of crime are not left alone to deal with courts, ombudsman, regulators, MP's, media and police plus all the paperwork and documentation it entails.

attributes.action: By law all Emergency Services Persons to be served before members of public
attributes.background: To make it compulsary by law that all on duty uniformed emergency services personnel are served at the front of ques in retail and food outlets to speed up the effieciency and working environments thus improving our response times and quality of staff

attributes.action: Set out a date for the introduction of care home fees cap.
attributes.background: The Government has been making false promises to put a limit on care home fees since 2011. Last election, the Government promised in its lying manifesto to introduce a cap.
attributes.additional_details: People like me and my family that have worked hard bought our own homes and have been  "prudent with our money," have not been "rewarded" as the Government promised.

attributes.action: Companies to accept all holiday requests from families during school holidays.
attributes.background: For those being told that they can’t have a certain week off and then left to find AND PAY for childcare because their existing provider is closed! Leaving them to give their child to a stranger which is expensive and potentially puts them at risk. All requests to be accepted even if they overlap
attributes.additional_details: I propose we make it legal that if you have 1 or more children under 16 and you request a week off during the school holidays to cover childcare, your company cannot refuse. Currently each company have their own rules around staffing, 1 person off at a time for example. Meaning you need to find a stranger to watch your child and pay for the risky privilege. Companies refuse to pay for cover for that week and we lose out. It helps families financially in a big big way and also stops worry.

attributes.action: Make the sale of Cannabis Seeds Illegal in the UK
attributes.background: It may surprise you that while it is illegal to have anything to do with Cannabis,it is fine to sell Cannabis Seeds.This may seem to you to be"Asking for trouble"and"Clearly stupid, contradictory & sending a mixed message".This is a loophole that allows cultivation to Start and allows gangs to form.
attributes.additional_details: Cannabis causes mental illness and disrupts educational progression. If as a Society we are opposed to it, we should be opposed to it all the way and not leave loopholes open so that "Head Shops" can sell cannabis seeds under the ludicrous pretext that they are doing it for sentimental reasons or for "genetic storage". This is a barefaced lie that puts the health of the Nation at risk.

attributes.action: Charge a set £5 fee for every use of the NHS (i.e. GPs, ambulance or hospital)
attributes.background: Although we pay a contribution toward the NHS from our wages I feel there should also be a set fee.  We pay for home and motor insurance that we may never use, and when we do we pay an excess.  I feel the NHS should be no different.
attributes.additional_details: The NHS is a great service, but society has changed considerably in the 70 years since its inception and the way the NHS is funded should be changed to reflect this.

attributes.action: Ratify Kampala amendments, give ICC jurisdiction over UK for crime of aggression
attributes.background:
The International Criminal Court, through the Kampala amendments (2010), is gaining jurisdiction over the crime of aggression on 17 July 2018, for those states that have ratified the amendments.

The UK, having pushed for this for decades, must ratify.
